column2: The Finmor use cruel ways to keep their servants fighting.
The Harbringer has blessed these Fimir warriors.
Restless and disturbed bands of Fimir, survivors of destroyed clans, now seeking for an end.
While Elfs are generally not the most friendly inhabitants of the Old World, they can be surprisingly nice when not stroking their large egos.
Argaad iz drunk, but y-yo-you don 'ave an.... zzzzzzzzz... zzzzz...... huh, wah, uhn excuz... zzzz....

This unit shoots [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/wh_main_unit_contact_souped.png]][[/img]]soup at enemy units, debuffing their [[img:icon_melee_attack]][[/img]]melee attack and [[img:icon_armour]][[/img]]armour for a long time.
Amazons coat their arrows in powerful venoms harvested from the exotic serpents found in Lustria; victims struck by such arrows are sent into wild bouts of hysteria.
Heavy strikes from these exotic clubs can debilitate and crush the defense of even the most armored of foes.
Bel'akor's body is unnaturally resilient to all kinds of damage. It will be difficult to bring this monster down.
It takes much of Bel'akor's concentration to suppress the unholy rage boiling within him. If he is pushed too far, he will rampage through the enemies lines with wild abandon.
The body of a Viridian Lord maintains form by the willpower and faith of the warrior soul inside alone. Once this determination wavers, the body starts to crumble.

Woad Paint is made and applied by druids and truthsayers. It binds excess winds of magic and protects the wearer from some of the physical attacks. If an area is saturated with unused magic, the protection provided will be more efficient.
Having mastered their temper, they no longer suffer from the mood swings so common in the warbands of Albion, allowing them to utilize their war fury without any drawbacks.
As long as they aren't too injured or weakened, the charge of this unit will be savage, uncompromising and simply devastating.
Even if the body is broken, Highlanders will attempt to fight on for some seconds, forcing their body to keep on moving by sheer willpower alone.
These warriors have focused on proving their worth on the battlefield. As long as their will is unbroken, they will push themselves beyond their limits.

These warriors have dedicated themselves to the Sun God who in turn imbues their weapons with flame and grants protection against fire, or so it is believed by the inhabitants. It may also be connected to a secret rite of initiation, overseen by the Truthsayers.
These Mummies have been embalmed and reinforced with secret ointments and oils, making their bodies highly resistant to damage - but also highly flammable.
Mummies are no mere zombies, they fight with skill and strength beyond normal humans. However, the way they have been preserved makes them slow on the advance.
The mere touch of a Mummy curses their opponents, sapping their strength and reducing their ability to fight back.
This unit has no offensive capabilities at all and exists only to support other units. It relies on its allies for protection.
The main purpose of this unit is to make the units around it better, not to gain kills by itself.
This dragon is very young, inexperienced and thrust into war far too early. They are at a disadvantage in air fights against more experienced flyers, even if those creatures look weaker.
Although this dragon is very young, it can still breath flames. They are not as strong or damaging as the flames of a young adult though.
While not really shielded, the legendary luck of the halflings causes a surprising amount of projectiles to be deflected by the pans, ladles and similar cooking tools the chefs wield.
If Trolls feel down, frightened or have otherwise low morale they will devour this unit to stay in the fight longer.
Night Trolls are known for their mocking laughter while they tear apart their opponents, intimidating their enemies that way.
These warriors are highly experienced and proficient fighters led by Sergeant Gunther Schepke, Bernhardt's second in command
This sword is enchanted with the energy of Bright magic.

The Shield of Ptolos is magically inscribed with a myriad of distracting patterns and designs. The patterns magically distract arrows and bolts, sending them spinning off course. The bearer's regiment will be protected against missiles from bows, crossbows, war engines and so on.
These artillerists are highly experienced and  led by Wolfgang Schwartzkopf

This mighty sword has runes inscribed along the blade by a Bright magic Wizard Lord. In hand-to-hand combat, the wielder strikes more accurately and ferociously against his enemies. Also, a fireball may be cast from the sword once per Magic Cycle.
The Enchanted Shield provides the bearer's regiment with an extra level of armour

The Spelleater Shield is inscribed with symbols which have the power to absorb enemy magic. Whenever the bearer's regiment is the target of an enemy spell the shield has a good chance of absorbing the magic.

On the orders of King Ungrunn Dragonbane, envoy Engrol Goldtongue with a small army of well-known regiments was sent to help the allied Empire. These dwarfs do not require salaries from Emperor, only a small amount of coins for self-serving food and beer.

According to the agreement with the Emperor, the soldiers of the regiments under the command of Morgan Bernhardt have the right to part of the trophies after the battles, and their commanders will receive titles and lands at the end of the campaign. In exchange, mercenaries will receive only half of their standard salary.

Taking their name from their Commander's powerful sword 'Grudgebringer' these mercenaries form the core of the army known as the Grudgebringers. They are skilled in combat and ride into battle on mighty warhorses.

These mercenaries, all expert crossbowmen, have a disreputable past. They originally formed part of a small bandit army working in the forests of Talabecland. After a crackdown which was aided by elite Imperial forces they fled south to evade capture. Currently residing in the Border Princes town of Wissenheim, and still on the Empire's wanted list, they seek anonymity by joining a legitimate mercenary army.
The hero is armed with runic weapons, forged by runesmiths
This unit is led by a powerful hero.
At a glance, the skiff may seem to be ineffective in battle, but it is protected by several Djinns who will fiercely defend their master.
This character is able to alter the course of battle with his food recipes.... somehow.

The towering frame of a skeletal giant can be seen far and wide on the battlefield. As such they are perfectly suited to serve as a conduit to channel the dark magic from the necromancer to his troops, anchoring them in the mortal world.
Skeletal Giants made from the dense bones of dead giants only. This makes them more resistant to small arms fire than their living counterparts.
River Trolls stink horribly - even compared to other trolls. Even the most repulsive or strong-willed beings need to overcome their natural disgust to engage them in close combat.
Stone Trolls have hard skin which makes them very resilient against physical or magical harm. However, once it is penetrated and the Trolls feel pain, they are easy to scare off the battlefield.

Other River Trolls already stink badly of rotting fish and riverbed, but Shipwreckers stink of rotting corpses, feces and waste. Even the bravest find it intolerable to stay close for long, let alone to fight efficiently.

These Trolls have been under the bosses command for a very long time already. They can follow simple orders to slightly alter their behaviour in battle. Due to their limited intelligence though, only one order per battle can be given to avoid confusion.
Despite being naturally camouflaged in forests, these monsters never understood the concept of sneaking. They are still difficult to spot from afar.
The regenerative ability of Bile Trolls is mostly occupied by keeping their many afflictions at bay. This means that wounds Bile Trolls receive are healing much slower compared to other Trolls.

Just being near Bile Trolls is a terrifying experience as the many gifts of Grandfather Nurgle constantly threaten to infect everyone around, weakening and frightening closeby enemies and allies alike.

Hurting these Trolls just makes them really angry. Not even the boss can maintain control over enraged Snow Trolls - usually it is not necessary though, since they will just pound the source of their anger into the ground.

The regenerative abilities of Lava Trolls are fully occupied, constantly repairing the damage the heat inside their bodies causes. These Trolls cannot regenerate damage received and heal as slowly as most 'normal' beings.
Lava Trolls radiate heat. Those who come too close to engage these monsters in melee are often burned by their proximity to the Lava Trolls alone.

Somehow Warpstone has fused to the skin of these creatures, making them resilient to all types of damage. And those who feel no pain will not retreat easily - at least as long as their protective shell persists.
The weapons made of crude, unrefined warpstone cause weird, unnatural effects on closeby targets, greatly increasing their desire to avoid being engaged in combat with monsters wielding them.
This unit is weak to ranged missile fire.
